Macro.name: Macro
Macro.description: Represents a macro, which is a set of instructions that tells the system to perform one or more tasks.

Description.description: Description of what this macro does.

FolderId.description: Returns the ID of the folder that contains the macro. Available in API version 44.0 and later.

FolderName.description: Name of the folder that contains the macro. Available in API version 44.0 and later.

IsAlohaSupported.description: Specifies whether the macro is supported in Salesforce Classic.

IsLightningSupported.description: Specifies whether the macro is supported in Lightning Experience.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time that the macro record was last referenced.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time that the macro record was last viewed.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of the session record.

StartingContext.description: The object the macro performs actions on. In Salesforce Classic, macros are supported on objects with both feed-based layouts and quick actions. In Lightning Experience, macros are supported on standard and custom objects that allow quick actions and have a customizable page layout.
